text: my name is Mathew Reinhardt and I am a
pop-up book designer it was one of those
kids who always Drew and I always made
stuff I study biology my parents really
wanted me to be a doctor life is short
and you've got to do something you
really love my first book that I
actually worked on was called the pop-up
book of phobias and it was weird it
adult sort of pop-up book and you know
all these different phobias came to life
and pop up the most important movie that
inspired me was or movie series was Star
Wars I did two Star Wars books one is
about the original trilogy one is about
the prequel trilogy I'm such a like geek
for Star Wars like I'm so into it
there's one character that was in the
cantina that you never see the lower
body of this character so I had to call
Lucasfilm to ask them do you have
anything to show the lower body because
I want to show the lower body I read all
the transformer comics because I love
transformers they very much inspired me
the toys as a kid really inspired me
because of the way that they come apart
and come back together and make
something else so I like take something
that's it's 2d and I make it 3d
I did one about Lego My Little Pony I
also did this great Game of Thrones a
couple years ago that actually turns
into a giant map what I like about that
book is it's it's inspired me to do more
books that kind of think outside the
book I've also done some books with some
really great illustrators and and
authors one of the biggest ones for me
very early on my career was with Maurice
Sendak called mommy it actually took
about four years to finish my tools that
I work with here in the studio like
scissors tape this cardstock glue I use
a knitting needle to make actually the
fold line so making a pop-up usually
takes about four or five months
sometimes six if it's a really big book
I'll make sort of an outline that's not
like a movie but you really do have to
think about it in scenes if the next
step is actually engineering the pop ups
and that's really just me in my studio
cutting and folding the paper and seeing
how all these things work together I
took it apart and then I'll trace all
the pieces using Adobe Illustrator and
make what are called dye lines and those
are the lines they use to cut out all
the different pieces for a book the next
step is making the artwork that goes on
you know it's kind of like the frosting
on a cake either I will make that
artwork and I have a definite different
styles that I use or I'll work with
another illustrator you give them sort
of a guide and sometimes they'll inspire
me and that'll change some of the
engineering so once all that artwork is
made then the artwork will be digitally
scanned put that underneath those dye
lines I created in a file all that
information along with one finalized
prototype that I've built by hand
we'll all go to the manufacturer so they
will analyze the book they'll analyze
prototypes of that scent and they'll
figure out the best way to build it and
it's all hand assembly and you know then
it goes on shelves initially when I
first started there were specific rules
like my mantra about it is you learn the
rules break the rules you learn new
rules repeat anyone could do it it's
just practice practice practice
